title: Monte Carlo Simulation – Random Sampling Risk & Uncertainty Calculator

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Define a model \( Y = g(X_1, X_2, \dots, X_k) \) where \( X_i \) are random inputs. Choose probability distributions for each \( X_i \) (e.g. normal, uniform, triangular). For each simulation run \( j = 1, \dots, N \): Sample \( x_1^{(j)}, x_2^{(j)}, \dots, x_k^{(j)} \) from their distributions. Compute the outcome \( y^{(j)} = g(x_1^{(j)}, \dots, x_k^{(j)}) \). Use the simulated outcomes \( y^{(1)}, \dots, y^{(N)} \) to estimate: Mean and standard deviation. Percentiles (e.g. 5th, 50th, 95th). Probabilities of events, e.g. \( \mathbb{P}(Y \geq y_0) \).
